d.description:
When rendering multiple quads via instancing, only some instances appear. 

ROOT CAUSE FOUND: Metal's float3 has 16-byte alignment, but Rust's [f32; 3] has 4-byte alignment. This caused:
- Rust QuadInstance: 112 bytes
- Metal QuadInstance: 128 bytes (due to float3 padding alignment)
- 16 byte mismatch per instance, causing Metal to read wrong offsets

FIX: Changed Metal shader from 'float3 _padding' to three separate 'float _pad1, _pad2, _pad3' fields. Individual floats have 4-byte alignment matching Rust.
